title: Tesco shoppers are STEALING shopping baskets instead of paying the plastic bag tax
text:
Tesco shoppers are STEALING shopping baskets instead of paying the plastic bag tax Tesco shoppers are STEALING shopping baskets instead of paying the plastic bag tax BRITAIN's biggest supermarket Tesco has been forced to put security tags on baskets to halt a surge in thefts since the plastic bag tax was brought in by the Government. PUBLISHED: 13:45, Wed, Oct 14, 2015 | UPDATED: 14:19, Wed, Oct 14, 2015 GETTY Tesco shopping baskets have been stolen in the wake of the plastic bag tax 
Tesco's Oldham store lost a third of its baskets in the week after the controversial 5p charge was been introduced on plastic bags in England at the beginning of October. 
The Chadderton Tesco has now fitted baskets with tags to stop shoppers using them to take shopping home. 
Some Tesco stores in London and Manchester have also tagged baskets off the back of the plastic bag ban. 
Tesco said it is a localised issue and not all baskets are to be tagged. 
All large retailers must now add 5p for each plastic bag on to shopping bills when a customer forgets to bring enough of their own bags or boxes to carry home shopping. 
But many people are not happy with the charge that is set to cost households hundreds of pounds over a lifetime and is likely to fail in its environmental aims, according to campaigners. Related articles
